data.question: What is the empirical formula and formula weight of Na[(L1-4-)CoIII]?
What are the crystal system and space group for Na[(L4-4-)CoIII]?
What is the temperature at which the crystal data for Na[(L1-4-)CoIII] was collected?
What is the method used for absorption correction in the structure refinement of Na[(L1-4-)CoIII]?
How does the crystal size of Na[(L4-4-)CoIII] compare to that of Na[(L1-4-)CoIII]?
data.answer: Na[(L4-4-)CoIII] has a crystal size of 0.12 x 0.1 x 0.08 mm3, which is slightly larger than Na[(L1-4-)CoIII]'s size of 0.21 x 0.1 x 0.07 mm3.

data.question: What is the role of NaH2PO4 in the synthesis conditions mentioned?
data.answer: NaH2PO4 acts as a component in the synthesis of Na[(L1-4-)CoIII] and Na[(L4-4-)CoIII], likely serving as a counterion or stabilizing agent in the formation of the complexes.

data.question: Based on the synthesis procedure, what modifications were made to the original literature procedure for the synthesis of the ligands?
data.answer: The synthesis procedure was slightly modified by performing the reaction under argon, using simultaneous drop-wise addition of solutions, and employing different purification methods for the ligands.

data.question: What is the significance of using DFT calculations in the study of the cobalt-catalyzed water oxidation mechanism?
data.answer: DFT calculations provide insights into the molecular details of the water oxidation catalytic cycle, including the oxygen-oxygen bond formation event, and help rationalize experimental observations such as electrochemical properties and water oxidation kinetics.

data.question: True or False: The crystal data for Na[(L1-4-)CoIII] and Na[(L4-4-)CoIII] were collected at the same temperature.
data.answer: False. Na[(L1-4-)CoIII] was collected at 173.1500 K, while Na[(L4-4-)CoIII] was collected at 178.2(9) K.

data.question: True or False: The absorption correction method used for Na[(L1-4-)CoIII] is also applicable to Na[(L4-4-)CoIII].
data.answer: True. Both structures used a semi-empirical method from equivalents for absorption correction.
